Arizona Winter School 2000
Course Descriptions and Notes

  • SHORTTITLE  Greg Anderson: Introduction to fermionic Fock space for number theorists

    • Course description: html
    • “Notes on fermionic Fock space for number theorists” (snapshot at the time of the Winter School): dvi, ps, pdf. Later versions may appear on Greg's web site.
    • “A determinantal procedure for calculating Jacobians of genus 1 curves.” project description: dvi, ps, pdf
    • Fragment of Maple code for calculating the tau functions appearing in the lectures: txt

  • SHORTTITLE  Nicholas Katz: Four lectures on Weil II

    • Polished course write-up, “L-functions and monodromy: four lectures on Weil II.”: pdf
    • “Mysterious formulae involving the numbers of points in some families of elliptic curves.” project description: html

  • SHORTTITLE  Kristin Lauter, René Schoof, and Michael Zieve: The number of points on a curve over a finite field

    • Course description: html
    • Schoof's Abuja notes are a good reference: dvi, ps, pdf.
    • Kristin Lauter and Michael Zieve have a three-part project entitled “Using class field theory to construct curves with many points.” (Kristin will supervise Parts 1 and 2 and Michael will supervise Part 3.)
      • Description: dvi, ps, pdf
      • Reference [6] in their bibliography: ps, pdf
      • Reference [7]: ps, pdf

  • SHORTTITLE  Peter Sarnak: Zeta functions and symmetry

  • SHORTTITLE  Douglas Ulmer: Elliptic curves over function fields and a Gross-Zagier theorem

    • Course description: html
    • Course outline: dvi, ps, pdf
    • “Explicit calculations with elliptic curves over function fields.” project description: dvi, ps, pdf
    • A very nice write-up of the project by Mihran Papikian: ps, pdf
    • A related paper: “Elliptic curves with large rank over function fields.”: arXiv
